commit message: Fix request method override header name
Code Style: Fix JSONHelper formatting

Step edit media overhaul

Step media in the guide create process was a mess.  Literally nothing was DRY,
the main image and thumbnail inflation was just duplicating ThumbnailView, and
code formatting was not followed.  This is the start at fixing all this.

I didn't intend for this commit to get so crazy, but as I was working on the
ThumbnailView conversion in the step edit fragments, I kept finding things I
wanted to change.  I know, horrible practice, but I couldn't help myself.
Because of this, the commit is a mess with way to many changes to be useful,
but below is my attempt at listing everything that is happening in here.

* Project and File organization
* Packages guide_create and guide_view --> guide.create and guide.view
* Removed some unused xml files (guide_step_body something)
* Abstracted out most of the guide create step media elements to use the same
elements as the guide stpe view page.  Drastically simplified the fragment
and DRYs everything up.
* Code formatting
* Moved 'title' edit field out of the media fragment and into the step lines
fragment.
* Misc code simplification.

Merge branch 'master' into guide-creation

Fix dialog display delay in SiteListActivity

Previously, we were waiting for the site list response to come back before
showing the dialog.  This is silly because if you are on a slow connection, the
delay between tap and dialog was 30-60 seconds and it seemed like the app was
broken.

Now, we launch the dialog right away, THEN fire off the request for the site
list, and show a nice loading indicator while we wait.

Clean up attrs, styles and themes

Code style convensions went out the door a while ago, and it's been catch up
ever since.

* App specific attributes will be prefixed with doz__ and the attribute name
will be camel cased (eg. doz__textAppearancePrimary)
* App specific styles will be UpperCased
* Themes will always inherit from Theme (eg. Theme.Dozuki)

Fix OutOfMemory errors in Guide View and Edit

Views sometimes will hold onto references to bitmaps which causes a slow memory
leak.  This was causing the app to crash after paging through 20 or so steps
(depending on the device).  Releasing the bitmaps and setting the imageviews to
null frees the bitmap from native memory and allows the GC to do its thing.

Perform logout API call on logout

We need to delete the user's auth token so it isn't valid anymore. Also,
remove LogoutDialog because it isn't used anymore.
Simplify image sizes else if condition

Robustify login prompting

Now if the user's session expire, we prompt them to log in and perform
the API call again once they are finished logging in just like we do if
the user isn't logged in to begin with. I had to change the way we
trigger the dialog to be opened because APIService doesn't have access
to any Activities. Now we post an event to the Bus that Activities
listen for and open the dialog when it comes along.

Fix finishing Activities on logged out user

If we thought that the user is logged in but it turns out they aren't,
MainApplication wasn't reset to indicate that the user isn't logged in
anymore. This updates our internal state when we get a 401 from an API
call so backing out of login dialogs works correctly.

Fix guide intro edit background crash

Fixes issue #77, where once the activity was destroyed, and reinitialized, the
app would crash because the fragments were firing off a callback to the
activity to get the current page before the wizard model was re-created.

Moving these callbacks to onCreateView instead of onCreate fixes it.

Always send along auth token in API calls

Now we send the user's auth token in all API requests to allow viewing
of private guides. This also bypasses varnish cache so changes will
actually be reflected when viewing the guide rather than being up to 10
minutes out of date.

Check for null join_date in user responses

Some users have a null join_date so we should check for that.

Use singleTask for Guide view/create activities

Hopping between guide view and step edit activities using the
singleTop/standard launch modes would add each instance of the activities to
the stack.  This caused some interesting problems with stale data with the
actions Edit > View > Edit > Save > View > Edit > Back > Back > Edit >
Save would cause a 409 since the Edit activity in the back stack does not have
the current revisionid.

Really what we want is only one instance of each guide view/edit activities,
which prevents this stale data problem from happening as well as the annoying,
seemingly pointless jumps between view/edit when going back multiple times.

Fixes #93, editing multiple guides doesn't work

Ditch singleTask, use singleTop without history.

Using singleTask got us almost all the way there with what we wanted,
but there was some edge case bugs that kept popping up with back pressed.

For example:
* Navigate to guide A from 'My Guides'
* View step 1
* Navigate to 'My Guides' through the menu drawer
* View Guide B, step 1
* Tap 'Back'
* Now the Guide A step list is showing which is wrong, Guide B list should be
there.

Also, if viewing multiple guides, going back wouldn't ever go back to those
previous guides you viewed, which could be jarring for users.

Using singleTop with a combination of NO_HISTORY and overriding back to just
launch a new intent fixed these issues and get us the interaction we were going
for all along.

Patch/Hack to prevent segfault from OkHttp

https://github.com/square/okhttp/issues/184

Because OkHttp uses the shared SSLContext, which also happens to be used by the
Google Analytics library, it would silently and abruptly cause an segfault
breaking everything.  The above issue mentions a workaround creating a new
sslcontext and setting the OkHttpClient to use that one instead of the default
sslcontext fixes it.

Do not finish activity on 403 responses

Anytime you got an insufficient priviledge error (403) from doing something
like changing the privacy of a guide (public to private), the activity would
finish after clicking OK on the dialog, which is unexpected for the user.

This commit also fixes some inconsistent UI issues as a result of failing
public/private toggles so after the request fails, the UI is updated to its
original state.
Prevent NPE when backing out of stepeditactivity too early

Catch DeadEvents from Otto and handle them

If an event is fired off and there isn't a subscriber waiting to recieve the
event, otto re-posts the event as a DeadEvent which holds a reference to the
original event.

DeadEvents were getting posted during step image capture if the user captured
an image, then immediatle started capturing another one before the upload
request returned.  If that happens and the image request comes back while we
are in capture mode, we store a reference to that deadevent and will retry it
again later once the handling activity is ready for it. This helps solve a
number of inconsistent state issues we were having with image upload.

Eliminate curfragment member var from activity

It was crashing the app during orientation changes in camera mode.  Instead,
use Otto like we do for images and fire off events everytime some line or title
change happens, and handle it in the activity.  Now, the activity is the
canonical source for guide data.
Synchronize array list to prevent concurrentmodificationexcpetions
Fix crash after saving new step and then adding new line
Use CopyOnWriteArrayList instead of synchronized arraylist since that didn't work
Fix jumping height on gallery grid view items

Use synchronized arraylist decorator

Instead of the CopyOnWriteArrayList for synchronizing modification of the
DeadEvent list in APIService. There was some unexpected behavior when removing
dead events.  Turns out, it works better to decorate the array list and
synchronize on that list when modifying and iterating over it.

Site list: Various search fixes

We weren't resetting the visibility of some views after we receive the
site list. They, the search view in particular, were stuck as hidden and
would never be displayed.

Fix crash on orientation changes with search text present. Calling

changing code in the dialog before the dialog was ready for it.

Also removed the subscribe since it doesn't receive Otto events.

Fix topic hierarchy on tablets

The topic hierarchy pane wasn't behaving properly - it was going back
when it was supposed to and wouldn't close if the right side of the
screen was tapped. Turns out the back stack listener was more important
than I thought. Even though we don't do as much as we used to with
mBackStackSize, we still need to listen for changes and show/hide the
topic list as necessary.

Enable concurrent AsyncTasks

By default AsyncTasks run in serial. We always want API calls to run
concurrently because there is no reason to wait on the responses of
prior API calls.

Navigate back to step list after delete last step

If you viewed a single step guide, then tapped edit, then deleted that step, it
would send you back to guide view, but you'd still see the now deleted step.
If you tapped edit or did anything on that step view, the app would crash.  Now
it always navigates back to the step list after deleting the last step in a
guide.

Instead of trying to squash all the symptoms of the problem, we should handle
the problem itself.  No need to update all the steps of the guide, which
doesn't include the new step, when we get the result of the publish request.

Fix logged out DeadEvent bug

Going back to an Activity that requires login crashed if the user was
logged out.

API requests: Don't follow redirects

1) We shouldn't rely on following redirects because it involves an extra
request which is especially slow for mobile.
2) It masks underlying problems.
3) It makes debugging harder.
4) Redirects on POST requests lose the request body on the second
request.

Associate a userid with each Activity

This will be used to determine whether or not the current user has
permission to view the Activity. For example: Userid 1234 views
`Activity A`, navigates to `Activity B`, logs out, Userid 5678 logs in,
navigates back to `Activity B` and views the previous user's content.

Finish Activities if userids don't match

This is so User A can't view data viewed by User B.
Fix GuideCreateActivity finishing on logout

Fix Logout events getting stuck in DeadEvents

Now we don't post Logout APIEvents to the Bus because a) we don't care
about the response which means that b) we don't listen for it.
Previously they were being posted and would get stuck in APIService's
list of DeadEvents because the Activity that it is associated with is
dead since they just logged out.
